from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# Initialize Spark session
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("CheckSparkExcelPackage") \
    .getOrCreate()

# Function to check if the package is installed
def check_spark_excel_package():
    try:
        # Attempt to read an Excel file
        df = spark.read.format("com.crealytics.spark.excel") \
            .option("header", "true") \
            .option("inferSchema", "true") \
            .load("abfss://juror-ingestion@baubaisadfsastg.dfs.core.windows.net/20241217/LA_Data/029-Blaby/31UB_blaby-district_001_2024.XLSX")
        
        # Show the DataFrame
        df.show()
        print("The com.crealytics.spark.excel package is installed and working correctly.")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")
        print("The com.crealytics.spark.excel package is not installed or not working correctly.")

# Check if the package is installed
check_spark_excel_package()

# Print the Spark session configuration
print(spark.sparkContext.getConf().getAll())
